table_caption: Descriptives. Sample data of the applied questionnaires, the valence ratings of the target stimuli and the reaction times in the social oddball paradigm. The two groups differed significantly in depressive and anhedonic symptomatology (SHAPS: t(52) = -5.262 , p < .001; BDI: t(52) = -13.217, p < .001), but not in facial valence ratings (t(52) = 1.428, p = .160) or recorded response times (t(52) = 0.234, p = .816).
